message: Purpose of the project is to build base projects on the fly, using a similar pattern to www.ninite.com
The site is temporarily at www.djangocanvas.com
It is very very beta, would be great to get some feedback, to help me finish it and polish it. :)

Looks kinda cool but I don't think I'd use it honestly. I'm used to doing all this stuff via hand and it's not painful or time consuming enough for me to warrant depending on a system such as this. I really appreciate what you're trying to do though. Left a comment about a checkbox issue.
@ryan_blunden thanks for commenting and writing about your point of view, I am fixing that checkbox bug now. Would you have any ideas on how to improve it's utility?
How about adding links to each project, and preferably to their docs.
I think it'll help newbies with project structure though, especially if you explain certain things.

While similar, everyone's default project build and structure will be different - if you can capture that so you can create your own "base" build, save it for the future and then build on top of that when you get new projects then that'd be an improvement. As it stands now : I don't store my requirements in a folder called requirements; I don't need .hgignore; local_settings is settings_local for me. etc etc.
Having said that, I think you'll always just be better off having your own base builder to fit your needs.
@djm Hi thanks a lot for your suggestion, I have been asked to add memorization and further customization of projects. I guess I should identify common patterns for setting up projects.
@jamespaxi I'm sure there's plenty here who could help with that :)
nice project but will be better smth like autosuggest field with django apps. and adding apps like facebook tags.also some known settings for each.
